scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
There is no Member State that includes LegalDocML in their national catalogue with The National Interoperability Framework (NIF) aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the European Interoperability Framework (EIF) according to the National Interoperability Framework Observatory (NIFO) factsheets.

CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement:
The purpose of LegalDocML is not related to the publication of public data as open data. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to this specification.

Tim Berners-Lee 5-star schema for Open Data:
https://5stardata.info/en/

LegalDocML reference:
https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/legaldocml/charter.php

statement:
OASIS has defined a clear Technical Committee (hereby TC) process where all the stakeholders involved have the opportunity to participate in the development of the specification development process.

OASIS guideline:
https://www.oasis-open.org/policies-guidelines/tc-process-2017-05-26

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is sufficiently mature for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
The specification was standardised officially in 2018 by OASIS, it was developed using the LegalDocML TC which is focused on promoting a common legal document standard (based on Akoma Ntoso-UN). 

The European Commission includes in its Rolling Plan for ICT Standardisation and in the related standardisation activities of the same rolling plan, more spcifically under the focus of eGovernment (1) Policy and Legislation; (2) Requested Actions. Due to this recommendation it can be considered that the specification is sufficiently mature for its use in the developments of products and services.

Moreover, LEOS project and pilot wich aims to ease the creation and management of Legal text is using it as basis. 

Akoma Ntoso: 
http://www.akomantoso.org/ 

The European Commission includes in its Rolling Plan for ICT Standarisation:
https://ec.europa.eu/digital-single-market/en/rolling-plan-ict-standardisation

LEOS: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/justice-law-and-security/solution/leos-open-source-software-editing-legislation/application-architecture

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
The European Commission includes in its Rolling Plan for ICT Standardisation and in the related standardisation activities of the same rolling plan. The specification has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services. The inclusion as basis for LEOS supports the fact that the specification has sufficient market acceptance according to the target audince. 

In addition, The LegalDocML TC works to advance worldwide best practices for the use of XML within a Parliaments', Assembly's or Congress' document management processes, within courts' and tribunals' judgment management systems, and generally in legal documents including contracts.

The European Commission includes in its Rolling Plan for ICT Standarisation:
https://ec.europa.eu/digital-single-market/en/rolling-plan-ict-standardisation

LegalDocML reference:
https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/legaldocml/charter.php

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the creation of innovative solutions.
statement:
At the moment of performing the assessment, LegalDocML is considered by the European Union as part of the standarisation activity. And, at the same time, it is used by LEOS, the European Project for Legal Texts Development. So LegalDocML can be considered as an asset to build innovative solutions.

The European Commission includes in its Rolling Plan for ICT Standarisation:
https://ec.europa.eu/digital-single-market/en/rolling-plan-ict-standardisation

LEOS: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/justice-law-and-security/solution/leos-open-source-software-editing-legislation

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has a strong support from at least one developer community.
statement:
The LegalDocML is developed by OASIS using the technical commities (TC). The goal of the TC in charge of LegalDocML development is to collect requirements from the community of the stakeholders who create, manage and use legislative and legal documents  in order to extend and refine the standard.
The main objective of the OASIS community is to promote individuals, organizations, and governments come together to solve some of the worldâs biggest technical challenges through the development of open code and open standards

LegalDocML reference:
https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/legaldocml/charter.php

OASIS home page: 
https://www.oasis-open.org/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the visibility of administrative rules, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement:
The LegalDocML TC works to advance worldwide best practices for the use of XML within a Parliaments', Assembly's or Congress' document management processes, within courts' and tribunals' judgment management systems, and generally in legal documents including contracts. 

The specification as can be domonstrated for its implementation in LEOS project and pilot, can ease and foster the visibility of data, administrative rules and ease the decision making process of public administrations. 

LegalDocML reference:
https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/legaldocml/charter.php

LEOS: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/justice-law-and-security/solution/leos-open-source-software-editing-legislation

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the comprehensibility of administrative rules, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement:
Following the purpose of the TC in charge of its development, LegalDocML can ease the accessibility of legal and administrative information commonly used and developed by public organisations and government bodies. The implementation within LEOS project demonstrates the usefulness of the specification in the visibility and the decision-making process of public administrations. Therefore, it can be concluded that the specification fosters the visibility of administrative rules, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.

LegalDocML reference:
https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/legaldocml/charter.php

LEOS: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/justice-law-and-security/solution/leos-open-source-software-editing-legislation

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification helps to ensure the availability of interfaces with internal information systems of a public administration.
statement:
The specification is used to encode and structure legal documents as XML, therefore it can help to the structured data exchange and the availability of interfaces with internal information. LEOS allows a common interface where this XML content is displayed in a user-friendly way to allow the creation and management of legal documents.

LegalDocML reference:
https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/legaldocml/charter.php

LEOS: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/justice-law-and-security/solution/leos-open-source-software-editing-legislation

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is reusable beyond the domain for which it was originally developed.Â
statement:
The business domain in which the specification was developed was mainly the administrations and the management of legal, political/administrative and contract management. However, this can be extended to other business domains where this kind of documents are basic for the development of the activity.

LegalDocML TC: 
https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/tc_home.php?wg_abbrev=legaldocml

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has been made available for its reuse by the organisations, administrations, open communities, etc. that developed it.
statement:
The LegalDocumentXML Specs provides a common legal document standard for the specification of parliamentary, legislative and judicial documents, for their interchange between institutions anywhere in the world and for the creation of a common data and metadata model that allows experience, expertise, and tools to be shared and extended by all participating peers, courts, Parliaments, Assemblies, Congresses and administrative branches of governments. 

The specification is publicly available at OASIS webpage. 

LegalDocML reference:
https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/legaldocml/charter.php

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is available for free on at least one national or European platform.
statement:
The LegalDocML is available for free at the SDO's webapge but it is also accessible through LEOS project and sofware application documentation, which can be found in joinup. 

LegalDocML reference:
https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/legaldocml/charter.php

LEOS: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/justice-law-and-security/solution/leos-open-source-software-editing-legislation

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is independent of any specific technology and/or platform.
statement:
LegalDocML is XML based, however, it is not dependent on any other technology or platform, so it can be implemented independently from specific technologies or platforms.

LegalDocML reference:
https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/legaldocml/charter.php

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is proportionate to the needs of its users (citizens, businesses or administrations).
statement:
One of the main purposes of the specification and the OASIS TC in charge of its development is to be extensible, that is to allow modifications to the models within the AKOMA NTOSO framework so that local customisation can be achieved without sacrificing interoperability with other systems.

Moreover, the European Commission includes in its Rolling Plan for ICT Standardisation and the related standardisation activities of the same rolling plan. Referencing it as a good candidate to support the eGovernment.

LegalDocML reference:
https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/legaldocml/charter.php

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters data portability between systems and applications supporting the implementation and evolution of European public services when legally possible.
statement:
The purpose of LegalDocML is to provide a format for long-term storage and access to parliamentary, legislative and judicial documents that allows search, interpretation and visualization of documents. Concequently, it can be said that the specification fosters data portability between systems and applications.

LegalDocML reference:
https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/legaldocml/charter.php

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification eases the implementation of the once-only principle.
statement:
The LegalDocML can be related also to contracts with legal bindings or relevance for the administration and regulatory boards. The specification can allow public administrations to define XML schemas for the reuse of information across borders including reference to contracts or other legal documents without requiring the submission or provision more than once. 

LegalDocML reference:
https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/legaldocml/charter.php

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters e-accessibility.
statement:
The purpose of LegalDocML is not related to e-accessibility. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to this specification.

LegalDocML reference:
https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/legaldocml/charter.php

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the secure and trustworthy data exchange between citizens and businesses, and public administrations.
statement:
LegalDocML has no requirement recognizing and executing the content on the receiving end. The receiving agents must ignore executable content coming from unsecured channels and/or unknown sources. However, the specification is XML based and it provides a set of common elements that are used to validate the information and the structure of the information exchange. This fact contributes to the trustworthy data exchange between parties.

LegalDocML reference:
https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/legaldocml/charter.php

Akoma Ntoso Media Type Version 1.0:
http://docs.oasis-open.org/legaldocml/akn-media/v1.0/csprd01/akn-media-v1.0-csprd01.html#_Toc417907373

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the delivery of multilingual European public services.
statement:
The LegalDocML is XML base, which allow the estructuration of legal documents data and its exchange between systems. This can also be used for instance, in  combination with the e-translation building block, to translate the content to other languages in the European Union. Then the collaboration between Member States can be improved using the method for the alignment of legal frameworks. 

LegalDocML reference:
https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/legaldocml/charter.php

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The adoption of the specification reduces the administrative burden.
statement:
The specification contributes to enchance and simplify the process of drafting legal documents. This fact helps to save time and resources by removing administrative burden that have been related to regulation drafting over the years. An example of this is the LEOS software. 

LegalDocML reference:
https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/legaldocml/charter.php

LEOS: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/justice-law-and-security/solution/leos-open-source-software-editing-legislation

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the long-term preservation of electronic records and other kinds of information.
statement:
The specification aims to provide a format for long-term storage and access to parliamentary, legislative and judicial documents that allows search, interpretation and visualization of documents. Therefore, LegalDocML can support and foster the long-term preservation of electronic records, especially legal texts.

LegalDocML reference:
https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/legaldocml/charter.php

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: There are already existing studies or documentation assessing the specification in terms of effectiveness and efficiency.
statement:
There are different documentation and studies related to the use of LegalDocML. An example is "Evaluating LegalDocML and LegalRuleML as a Standard for Sharing Normative Information in the AEC/FM Domain analyses the LegalDOCML specification"

Evaluating LegalDocML and LegalRuleML as a Standard for Sharing (...):
https://www.researchgate.net/publication/318010726_Evaluating_LegalDocML_and_LegalRuleML_as_a_Standard_for_Sharing_Normative_Information_in_the_AECFM_Domain

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification can be mapped to the European Interoperability Reference Architecture (EIRA).
statement:
At the moment of performing the assessment, the specification is not mapped with any EIRA ABBs and therefore it is not included in the ELIS v1.0.1. 

However, it has been associated with Legal ABBs from EIRA Legal View and is being included in the on-going version of the ELIS that will be released in May 2021.  The ABBs included are: Legal Act, Binding Instrument, Legislation On Data Information and Knowledge Exchange and Non-Binding Instrument.

ELIS Solution: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/solution/elis 

ELIS v1.0.1: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/solution/elis/release/v101-0

criterion_description: Mechanisms to assess conformity of the implementations of the specification (e.g. conformity tests, certifications) are available for free.
statement: After carrying out an exhaustive search concerning LegalDocML validation, conformance and certification, no tool has been found available for free for these purposes.

statement:
There are no Member States recommending LegalDocML in their ICT National Catalogues.
 
CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has been selected for its use in an EU cross-border project or initiative after agreed identification and assessment.
statement:
The specification has been selected within the scope of LEOS project to develop the LEOS software, which aims to ease the drafting and edition of legal documents. 

Moreover, LegalDocML has been included  within the European Commission's Rolling Plan for ICT Standarisation and in the related standardisation activities of the same report.

LEOS: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/justice-law-and-security/solution/leos-open-source-software-editing-legislation

The European Commission includes in its Rolling Plan for ICT Standarisation:
https://ec.europa.eu/digital-single-market/en/rolling-plan-ict-standardisation

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is included in a catalogue of standards at national level.
statement:
LegalDocML is not included in any Member States' catalogues of recommended specifications.

CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is included in a catalogue of standards at EU level.
statement:
After checking the different standard catalogues at supra-national level, there is no evidence of the inclusion of LegalDocML within any European catalogue of standards.

ICT technical specifications:
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en 

CEN search tool catalogue:
https://standards.cen.eu/dyn/www/f?p=CENWEB:105::RESET::::

CENELEC search tool catalogue:
https://www.cenelec.eu/dyn/www/f?p=104:107:0::::FSP_LANG_ID:25

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is included in an interoperability agreement established between organisations involved in European public service provision.
statement:
No evidence has been found of the specification being included in a formal interoperability agreement between organisations involved in the European public services provision. 

However, LegalDocML has been included  within the European Commission's Rolling Plan for ICT Standarisation and in the related standardisation activities of the same report.

The European Commission includes in its Rolling Plan for ICT Standarisation:
https://ec.europa.eu/digital-single-market/en/rolling-plan-ict-standardisation

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is compliant with a European standardisation regulation (e.g. regulation 1025/2012 on European standardisation).
statement:
After checking the assessments performed by CAMSS and the list of specifications identified by the MSP Multi-stakeholder-platform, no assessment verifying the compliance of the specification with the European standardisation regulation has been found.

ICT technical specifications:
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is a commonly accepted business process modelling specification.
statement:
The purpose of LegalDocML is not related to the modelling of business processes. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification. 

LegalDocML reference:
https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/legaldocml/charter.php

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification defines organisational interoperability aspects (e.g. skills, language, etc.).
statement:
The LegalDocML TC works to advance worldwide best practices for the use of XML within a Parliaments', Assembly's or Congress' document management processes, within courts' and tribunals' judgment management systems, and generally in legal documents including contracts. It can be concluded that the specification fosters defining organisational interoperability aspects

LegalDocML reference:
https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/legaldocml/charter.php

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification defines a cross-sector reusable data model.
statement:
LegalDocML is aimed to define a common data and metadata model towards the maximisation of information reuse. It is focused on administration purposes mainly for public administrations, but it also can be extended to more specific sectors requiring legal document management and processing.

LegalDocML reference:
https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/legaldocml/charter.php

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the publication of data as Linked Open Data.
statement:
The purpose of LegalDocMC is not related to the publication of public data as linked open data. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to this specification. 

LegalDocML reference:
https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/legaldocml/charter.php
